Class InputManager

java.lang.Object
parade.helpers.inputHandlers.InputManager
public class InputManager extends Object
Manages user input mode switching and delegates input to the appropriate handler. Supports both line-based and menu-based input through LineInputHandler and MenuInputHandler.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected InputHandler
    currentHandler
    The currently active input handler.
    protected LineInputHandler
    lineHandler
    Handler for line-based input (text entry).
    protected MenuInputHandler
    menuHandler
    Handler for menu-based input (interactive selection).
    protected org.jline.terminal.Terminal
    terminal
    The JLine terminal instance used for reading input.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    InputManager()
    Constructs an InputManager and initializes both input handlers with a shared terminal.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputManager

      public InputManager()
      Constructs an InputManager and initializes both input handlers with a shared terminal. Sets line input as the default mode.

  • Method Details

    • turnSelect

      public SelectionInput turnSelect(ParadeBoard paradeBoard, Player currentPlayer)
      Requests turn input from the player using their preferred input method.
      Parameters:
      paradeBoard - the current parade board state
      currentPlayer - the player making a decision
      Returns:
      the selection made by the player

    • ensureLineInput

      public void ensureLineInput()
      Switches to the line input handler if it is not already active.

    • ensureMenuInput

      public void ensureMenuInput()
      Switches to the menu input handler if it is not already active.

    • getIntroInput

      public ActionInput getIntroInput(String[] introActions) throws IOException
      Displays the intro menu and waits for the player to select an action.
      Parameters:
      introActions - the list of intro menu options
      Returns:
      the action input selected by the player
      Throws:
      IOException - if input fails

    • getInt

      public int getInt(String prompt)
      Prompts the player for an integer input.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to display
      Returns:
      the integer entered by the player

    • getIntInRange

      public int getIntInRange(String prompt, int min, int max)
      Prompts the player for an integer within a specific range.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to display
      min - the minimum allowed value (inclusive)
      max - the maximum allowed value (inclusive)
      Returns:
      the validated integer entered by the player

    • getString

      public String getString(String prompt)
      Prompts the player for a string input.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to display
      Returns:
      the string entered by the player

    • getYesNo

      public boolean getYesNo(String prompt)
      Prompts the player with a yes/no question.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the question to display
      Returns:
      true if the player answers yes, false otherwise

    • getEnter

      public void getEnter()
      Waits for the player to press Enter before continuing.
